pr_title: Kogito 2275 - trusty service uses persistence abstraction

timeline.message:
Revert "Update trustyCI.yml"

This reverts commit e28aaa2c0876b61441bec40203b1ca39d066630d.
use the trusty storage layer to retrieve executions
move protobuf domain to api and remove unused imports
remove getProtobufCache from DataIndexStorageManager, ProtobufService injected directly in protobuf manager
add enum marshaller to be fixed
update poms, rename kogito.data-index.storage.type, optimize imports
Merge branch 'KOGITO-2326-storage-abstraction' of https://github.com/r00ta/kogito-apps into KOGITO-2326-storage-abstraction
remove kogito prefix from persistence modules
Provide the parametrized type in AttributeFilter
refactoring and implementation of getDecisionById method
run integration tests in pom and handle already existing elements with tests

timeline.bodyText: Is there any reason to use context classloader "Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader()" instead of "this.getClass().getResourceAsStream()".
timeline.author: jiripetrlik

replies.bodyText: Hi, the equivalent code would be this.getClass().getClassLoader().getResourceAsStream("META-INF/decision.proto")). TCCL is in general preferred, but in this case it's not a big deal (https://access.redhat.com/solutions/3097731). lmkwyt
replies.author: r00ta
jiripetrlik

replies.bodyText:
For the record, fine for me to review this usage but if we decide to change, please update this too 
  
    
      kogito-apps/data-index/data-index-storage/data-index-storage-protobuf/src/main/java/org/kie/kogito/index/protobuf/ProtostreamProducer.java
    
    
        Lines 35 to 36
      in
      3604788
    
    
    
    

        
          
           source.addProtoFile(KOGITO_INDEX_PROTO, Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader().getResourceAsStream("META-INF/kogito-index.proto")); 
        

        
          
           source.addProtoFile(KOGITO_TYPES_PROTO, Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader().getResourceAsStream("kogito-types.proto"));
replies.author: danielezonca

replies.bodyText: ok, If you agree I would change it for trusty in the current PR, and then in another one I'll change it for the data-index
replies.author: r00ta

replies.bodyText: To be honest it is fine for me to stay with the current code, I just mentioned that the same strategy is used in data-index so if we will change, we should update that code too. :)
replies.author: danielezonca

replies.bodyText: Also from my side I think we can stay with the current implementation.
replies.author: r00ta

replies.bodyText: Ok, I have no problem with it.
replies.author: jiripetrlik

timeline.bodyText: It seems that this logger is not used.
timeline.author: jiripetrlik

timeline.bodyText: MessageMarshaller is deprecated according to Sonar cloud.
timeline.author: jiripetrlik

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I know. Currently the documentation of infinispan still uses it (https://infinispan.org/docs/dev/titles/developing/developing.html), and this is currently what we do in the data-index (https://github.com/kiegroup/kogito-apps/search?q=MessageMarshaller&unscoped_q=MessageMarshaller). I'll look for an alternative
replies.author: r00ta

replies.bodyText: Apparently this is the only method to create a custom marshaller when it is not possible to annotate the class that has to be stored (in this case Decision). As a matter of facts, the idea is that Decision is in the api module and it is not infinispan specific. I'll ping the infinispan team to understand if there is an alternative
replies.author: r00ta

replies.bodyText: Unfortunately, this feature still has to be implemented https://issues.redhat.com/browse/IPROTO-137 . lmkwyt @jiripetrlik
replies.author: r00ta

replies.bodyText:
@r00ta
Hello, thank you for quick reply! I think we can keep deprecated interface for now and comment it with TODO and link to the https://issues.redhat.com/browse/IPROTO-137. Once IPROTO-137 is finished we can decide what to do about it.

timeline.bodyText:
If you are not using REST api nor using many injections, you can probably use a plain unit test without QuarkusTest.
I would suggest you to create a constructor in TrustyService that accept TrustyStorageService and move @Inject annotation directly on the constructor.
In this way you can easily instantiate the service in a @Before method using a mock, a mocked implementation or the real instance with better control.
Wdyt?
timeline.author: danielezonca

replies.bodyText: I've avoided QuarkusTest now, let me know if it looks good to you
replies.author: r00ta

replies.bodyText: Implemented as agreeded by phone call
replies.author: r00ta

timeline.bodyText:
Side note related to this class: if you really want to test TrustyStorageService and TrustyService in two different classes you should try to properly split test logic: most (all?) the logic is inside TrustyStorageService so here you should probably just verify (using Mockito) that method A is invoking method B etc.
The risk is to test the implementation and/or test the mock logic you just defined.
I think it could be better to have a single test class to cover the logic of both. Wdyt?
timeline.author: danielezonca

replies.bodyText: Currently TrustyStorageService is not really tested anywhere, since it is only exposing the "cache" of the decisions. I think the TrustyStorageService should be mocked anyway in the tests of the TrustyService. I know there is not much to test, as a matter of facts I've implemented just 3 unit tests and some integration tests for the TrustyService. Let's have a call to better clarify your points
replies.author: r00ta

timeline.bodyText: Can you please add a test to verify that all fields of Decision are covered (if possible use a mechanism that dynamically takes methods from Decision so that if we add a field the test fails
timeline.author: danielezonca
